alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains of Oregon; East Slopes of Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 18 at 6:45AM PDT until August 18 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY THROUGH THIS EVENING... .Winds will be slightly higher than experienced on Thursday, as gusts of up to 35 mph will be possible. This, combined with the recent heat wave and RHs in the teens, will make for critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR610 AND OR640... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 610 East Slopes of Central Oregon Cascades and 640 Central Mountains of Oregon. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Winds and critically low humidity values can contribute to rapid fire spread and extreme fire behavior.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central Mountains of Oregon; East Slopes of Central Oregon Cascades
